description: Design system with comprehensive responsive design rules

layout.section_rhythm: Alternating backgrounds (White <-> Navy) must be strictly enforced across all screen sizes

header.responsive_behavior: Sticky on scroll, collapse to compact version on mobile

buttons.responsive_behavior: Stack vertically on mobile (xs), inline on tablet+

icons.alignment: Center content within a colored box

images.responsive_behavior: Use srcset and sizes attributes, load optimized images per breakpoint

hover_effects.mobile_note: Disable hover effects on touch devices (use @media (hover: hover))

scroll_animations.mobile_behavior: Reduce animation distance on mobile (15px instead of 30px)

touch_interactions.swipe_enabled: Enable swipe for carousels and galleries on mobile

layout.xs: Single column, text center, image below text
layout.md: Single column, text left, image as background
layout.lg: Two column, text left (50%), image right (50%)

layout.xs: Single column - image top, content bottom

image_order.md: Alternate: odd sections image-left, even sections image-right

layout.xs: Single column, image hidden or small
layout.md: Two column, image left (40%), content right (60%)
Inline: heading + text left, button right

implementation_guide.css_strategy: Use CSS Variables (:root) for all colors. Use CSS clamp() for fluid typography.
implementation_guide.html_structure: Use semantic tags (header, section, footer). Each section must have a clear class like .section-dark or .section-light.

responsive_strategy.approach: Mobile-first (start with xs, add complexity with min-width media queries)
responsive_strategy.grid_system: CSS Grid with auto-fit/auto-fill for flexible columns
responsive_strategy.flexbox_usage: Flexbox for component-level layouts, Grid for page-level structure

accessibility.contrast: WCAG AA minimum - ensure high contrast for text on Navy background
accessibility.focus_states: Visible focus indicators on all interactive elements
accessibility.responsive_text: Use rem units for accessibility, allow user zoom up to 200%

performance.images: Use WebP format with fallbacks, lazy load below-fold images
performance.fonts: Preload Pretendard font files, use font-display: swap
performance.critical_css: Inline above-the-fold CSS for faster First Contentful Paint
performance.mobile_first_assets: Load mobile-optimized assets first, progressively enhance for larger screens

testing_checklist: Test on iPhone SE (375px) - smallest common mobile
Test on large desktop (1920px+) - ensure content doesn't stretch too wide
Test with browser zoom at 150% and 200%
Test touch interactions on real devices
Validate with Chrome DevTools device emulator

replit_instructions.CRITICAL_RULE: ⚠️ THIS DESIGN SYSTEM MUST BE APPLIED TO EVERY PAGE WITHOUT EXCEPTION ⚠️
replit_instructions.framework_recommendation: Use Tailwind CSS for rapid responsive development (matches this design system)
must_implement: Mobile-first responsive design - start with xs breakpoint
All sections must work from 320px to 2560px width
Flexible grid layouts using CSS Grid
Sticky header that adapts on mobile
Test on multiple breakpoints before delivering
replit_instructions.code_structure: Create separate CSS files for each breakpoint to maintain clarity
replit_instructions.component_approach: Build each component mobile-first, then enhance for larger screens

consistency_enforcement.rule: Every new page MUST reference this design system. No exceptions.
workflow: 1. Read design-system-responsive.json BEFORE starting any page
2. Use ONLY colors defined in colors.brand and colors.neutral
3. Use ONLY typography sizes from typography.hierarchy
4. Follow section_patterns for all page sections
5. Apply responsive breakpoints exactly as defined
6. Test on all breakpoints (xs, sm, md, lg, xl) before completion
forbidden_actions: ❌ DO NOT create custom colors outside the defined palette
❌ DO NOT use random font sizes - use only defined hierarchy
❌ DO NOT create inconsistent button styles
❌ DO NOT break the alternating section rhythm
quality_checklist_before_delivery: ✅ All colors match design-system colors exactly
✅ Typography uses defined hierarchy (h1_hero, h2_section, etc.)
✅ Responsive at xs(375px), md(768px), lg(1024px), xl(1280px)
✅ Buttons use defined styles (solid_primary, outline_white, pill_badge)
✅ Cards have correct border-radius (12px mobile, 16px desktop)
✅ Touch targets are minimum 44x44px on mobile

per_page_instructions.when_creating_new_page: ALWAYS start with: 'Based on design-system-responsive.json, I will create [page name] with...'

template_structure.step_1: Import/reference the global design system CSS variables
template_structure.step_2: Use section_patterns to determine page structure
template_structure.step_4: Implement responsive layout using defined breakpoints
template_structure.step_5: Test on all breakpoints before showing to user

reusable_components.header: Use header definition from ui_components.header - SAME across all pages
reusable_components.footer: Create once, reuse everywhere with consistent styling
reusable_components.buttons: Use ONLY defined button types: solid_primary, outline_white, pill_badge
reusable_components.cards: Always use cards definition from ui_components.cards
reusable_components.icons: Follow icons definition: boxed style, defined sizes per breakpoint

version_control.rule: If design system is updated, ALL existing pages must be reviewed and updated to match
version_control.changelog_requirement: Document any deviations from design system with clear reasoning

global_css_template.description: This CSS must be included in EVERY page as a global stylesheet

content_structure.css_variables: Define all colors, spacing, typography as CSS variables in :root
content_structure.base_styles: Set Pretendard font, base font-size 16px, box-sizing border-box

page_templates.description: Pre-defined page structures that follow design system

structure: Content + Image Section (navy background, alternating layout)
landing_page.responsive_behavior: All sections collapse to single column on mobile, expand to multi-column on desktop

structure: Related Products (white, horizontal scroll on mobile)
Timeline Section (white, vertical on mobile, horizontal on desktop)
Form + Map Section (white, two-column on desktop)
